item.title: Riot Activates In-Game Fundraisers in VALORANT, League to Support LA Wildfire Relief
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/riot-activates-in-game-fundraisers-in-valorant-league-to-support-la-wildfire-relief/

Riot Games announced today that the company will be launching “in-game fundraisers” in VALORANT and League of Legends to support relief for the wildfires affecting the city of Los Angeles. Riot says the fundraisers will go live next week, and are part of several initiatives that the company has undertaken to aid the city it’s based in.

The wildfires in Los Angeles started earlier this month, destroying hundreds of homes and doing billions in damage.

A Chance For VALORANT and League Players to Do Some Good

Beginning January 22nd, the latest EX.O skin collection in VALORANT will be converted to a Give Back Bundle. Proceeds from the bundle items will go directly to the Riot Games Social Impact Fund. VALORANT has featured a Give Back Bundle, featuring fan-voted skins from other collections, every year since the game’s release. In previous iterations, 50 percent of skin proceeds and 100 percent of accessory proceeds are sent to the Fund. The EX.O bundle will leave the store on January 30th.

Additionally, League of Legends is un-vaulting Firefighter Tristana on January 23rd until February 5th. Firefighter Tristana was originally released back in 2010, and is one of the rarer skins that League fans have wanted to get their hands on.

At the beginning of today’s VALORANT Champions Tour Americas broadcast, Head of VALORANT Esports Leo Faria addressed the wildfires. He implored fans to donate to the California Fire Foundation and the International Medical Corps.

Since the wildfires began tearing up the city, Riot has provided temporary housing and stipends to displaced employees, donated meals, and even provided a backup generator to a local fire station that had lost power. The developer says it is “in this for the long-term and will support both the immediate response and years-long recovery efforts in Southern California.”

Willing to support LA wildfire relief by buying some skins? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our exclusive report on the effects of Microsoft’s purchase of Activision Blizzard.

item.title: Two More PlayStation Live Service Games Have Been Cancelled, Including God of War
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/playstation-live-service-games-cancelled-report/

It has been revealed in a recent report that Sony has cancelled two more PlayStation live service games, one at Bend Studio and the other at Bluepoint Games. It was further highlighted after the report aired that one of the cancelled games, being pieced together but Bluepoint, was a live-service God of War game.

The report stressed that ‘a recent review’ led to the cancellation of these two unannounced titles, and that following this revelation, PlayStation intends to continue supporting the development of single-player and multiplayer games.

Never To Be Revealed

In a recent article posted by Bloomberg’s Jason Schreier, it was revealed that two live-service games destined for PlayStation were abruptly cancelled. It was mentioned that neither impacted studio will be closed down:

Bend and Bluepoint are highly accomplished teams who are valued members of the PlayStation Studios family, and we are working closely with each studio to determine what are the next projects.

This is the latest in a long line of live-service titles canned by PlayStation in recent years.

On social media, Schreier confirmed that the Bluepoint title would have been a live-service God of War game. It’s not known what the Bend Studio game was going to look like, but early last year, the studio was hiring developers to work on an AAA live-service game with a military sci-fi ‘feel’.

Bend Studio suffered some ‘leaks’ in December, with images being shared online of the company’s (now cancelled) game. The images were reportedly produced from a Google Drive and they were subjected to DMCA notices from PlayStation, which lend credence to their legitimacy.

What would you have wanted from a live-service God of War game? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that a Nintendo Switch 2 hands-on experience is being organised

item.title: Best CS2 Launch Options
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-cs2-launch-options/

The best Counter-Strike 2 launch options can set you up for a fun, rewarding gameplay session before you even join a server. There a number of launch options that CS2 players can utilize to improve performance, and they’re relatively easy to implement. These will instantly apply settings that will boost your game.

Before you jump below, consider trying your luck on Clash.gg – you could turn your unwanted skins into something much more valuable (18+ only)

How to Apply Launch Options to CS2

Launch options can be applied to CS2 through Steam. To access launch options, right-click Counter-Strike 2 and select Properties. Under the main General tab, there will be a section called “Launch Options” with a single text box.

This box is where you will enter your launch options. Each option is a string of text consisting of letters, numbers, and various symbols. Each individual option consists of zero spaces, so you will use spaces between each launch option. Do not include any quotations marks when applying launch options.

Best CS2 Launch Options

Here are the best Launch Options for maximizing performance and FPS in CS2. If you’re copying and pasting these directly into your settings, make sure you are only copying and pasting the bolded section, including the plus or minus sign at the start.

  • +fps_max 0 – This is an essential launch option for players using high-end PCs, as it removes your maximum frames per second. For PCs that aren’t high-end, set the 0 value to 200.
  • -high – This option denotes CS2 as a high priority process for your computer. This is a useful option for lower-end systems, but for all systems it will take divert processes away from other programs you have open. It can also occasionally lead to more frequent crashing.
  • -softparticlesdefaultoff – This option disables the blending of particle effects with the background, reducing system stress and improving CS2 performance.
  • -nojoy – This options disable joystick support, which will free up a small amount of RAM.
  • +mat_disable_fancy_blending 1 – This option disables “fancy blending,” making textures look less detailed but more smooth, improving performance.

If you want to apply all of these launch options at once, enter this into your Launch Options menu in Properties:

  • +fps_max 0 -high -softparticlesdefaultoff -nojoy +mat_disable_fancy_blending 1

Truth be told, if you have a high-end PC, then most of these options other than removing the max FPS will only be minor improvements. They won’t be substantial enough to explain why you’ve gone negative in your last few Premier matches.

Are there better launch options you use when playing CS2? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

If you want to unlock free daily cases and rewards in CS2, check out Clash.gg (18+ only)

For more of the latest esports news, stay tuned to Insider Gaming.
